Find and Manage Providers

column33: 2018";1709871072000;"2.52.1";"We’ve rolled out some changes to make our UHC app easier and more reliable to use.";"[""As a first time user of UCard I must say it's been a frustrating experience for me and my husband. The app scanner tells me a product qualifies and the register at Walmart doesn't reflect what the app says. Twice we had to put items back that were not covered. Not a good introduction to UHC. I only added the app for the scanner. It doesn't work and has been no benefit whatsoever. I'll be removing it from my phone.""
column34: App refuses sync with my tracker. It says connected. I've checked all permissions. And trying to reconnect just creates a never ending spinner. Data hasn't synced in days. How can you fairly offer rewards if the app is busted!? The fitness rewards was a deciding factor in switching coverage to my employers options. TERRIBLE CHOICE. There are only two doctors in my whole city
column35: otherwise I have to travel out of state. And the features offered don't work. I'm stuck here for a whole year.""
column37: Rally was much better. It will pull in data just fine and acknowledge you achieved daily/weekly goals
column38: but will then fail to pay you what is owed. This happens at least once a week
column39: sometimes with the big bonus rewards. 100% the apps fault
column40: as it will even tell you goals are met. I take it there is little incentive for UHC to fix this as they don't want to give you the money.""
column42: it forces 2 factor every time even if you check remember device - you provide the code and it just spins on a blank screen. Tried updating the app
column44: no error messages just a blank screen with a spinning dial forever. If you close and reopen you have to authenticate again then it goes right back to the blank screen.""
column45: incredibly slow despite wifi. external links to website cannot verify credentials despite being signed IN to both. PAY BILL button is literally lost in the tutorials and \""how-to's\"". this was such a mess. all because the automated system can't understand \""utilities\"" anymore. fantastic idea. but troubleshooting and maintenance are dire for success. if things improve

column1: MyChart;"MyChart puts your health information in the palm of your hand and helps you conveniently manage care for yourself and your family members. With MyChart you can:
•	Communicate with your care team.
•	Review test results
•	Connect your account to Google Fit to pull health-related data from your personal devices right into MyChart.
•	View your After Visit Summary® for past visits and hospital stays
column2: along with any clinical notes your provider has recorded and shared with you.

column1: •	Schedule and manage appointments
column2: including in-person visits and video visits.

column1: •	Get price estimates for the cost of care.
•	View and pay your medical bills.
•	Securely share your medical record from anywhere with anyone who has Internet access.
•	Connect your accounts from other healthcare organizations so you can see all your health information in one place
column2: even if you've been seen at multiple healthcare organizations.

column1: •	Receive push notifications when new information is available in MyChart. You can check whether push notifications are enabled under the Account Settings within the app.

Note that what you can see and do within the MyChart app depends on which features your healthcare organization has enabled and whether they’re using the latest version of Epic software. If you have questions about what’s available
To access MyChart
column2: you must create an account with your healthcare organization. To sign up for an account
column3: download the app and search for your healthcare organization or go to your healthcare organization’s MyChart website. After you’ve signed up
column4: turn on fingerprint authentication or set up a four-digit passcode to quickly log in without needing to use your MyChart username and password each time.

column1: For more information about MyChart’s features or to find a healthcare organization that offers MyChart

column29: 2011";1709928275000;"10.8.3";"First-time app setup and organization management have had a modern refresh. Shortcut management and visibility have been improved. Starting with Android 13
column30: you can choose a language for your MyChart account in-app using a new option in Account Settings. Your organization must support more than one language to see this option. These features are available immediately to all users who upgrade the app.";"[""It's a great app to keep track of all your health information. Upcoming appointments
column33: allergies all in one place. Also a great way to keep in contact with your doctors and interact with them when problems arise. Some of my doctors don't have My Chart and it's difficult reaching them
column35: This is by far one of best apps I've ever used. I've never had any issues with notifications
column36: linking and syncing with other networks
column37: combining children's patient profiles with parents. For the developer team who deployed this and continue to improve and update
column38: they need some serious recognition for creating an app that works better than all of the very popular apps available. Still puzzled why this hasn't received the prestigious **Editor's Choice badge. Seriously
column41: I must say that no one rivals EPIC in UI design. Still the champ of an intuitive and user-friendly system!! Wow. I really have to compliment the EPIC Corporation for this app! Smooth
column44: and friendly UI. Has the many functionalities I need to review my health history with the clinic. What really impressed was the display of lab values which visually shows the normal range for each test. Keep up the good work App Team!""
column45: It would be an excellent app if it worked like it is supposed to. However
column47: most appointments can not be scheduled online
column48: and if you ever try to message your providers
column49: they never bother to respond. I want to edit my review. I think
column51: there are no problems with the App. I think that the problems are on the side of my Providers.""
column52: This app would be a great idea if it actually worked. When I was entering my new insurance the app would not let me take a photo of the new insurance card. I tried numerous times to take the photo and each time the app would boot me totally out and take me back to the login page. I finally gave up! Then it wanted me to verify my phone number which has been the same for over 20 years but it never would send the code. This app has big problems and I don't like using it period!! I call it a JOKE!""]";false;false;false;"epic.mychart.android";"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=epic.mychart.android&hl=en&gl=us"
